column4: I'm dual-booting and Windows wrecked my MBR... how can I get the nice bootloader Dapper installed for me back?
Hopefully I won't need to redo the grub.conf or whatever?
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows
Thanks, wrestling with grub now =)
I wasn't really following, but that wiki page should allow you to recreate the proper boot for ubuntu. What's the issue?

I followed those instructions, but grub and grub-install gave me various errors, and I may have stepped a little too far into the install script, and I'm afraid it may have erased the Linux install on my original partition
ouch.
I guess the good news is that I only did the install day before yesterday
yeah, that is gooooood news :)
I'm fscking it now just in case, but anyways, it's weird that grub didn't want to run any of the commands on that page you gave me
hrm. Me, I don't run windows, so I point people at that page because it seems to work.
Doesn't grub need a config file of some kind?
Ahh, I've my old partition back... Now I can go into the /boot directory and use the menu.lst that's there?
if it's properly made, and referenced propery by update-grub & grub-install, of course :)
Well, the one from my previously working Kubuntu partition should be good =)
check it carefully.
Whoops, now I have two bootloaders
The pretty Kubuntu one and the plain grub one
I try to know as little about grub as needed.
Knowing how to use grub is like knowing where your fire extinguisher is... Usually doesn't seem like useful knowledge until you need it
I bring out lilo when I need the fire extinguisher :)
